ZGBody.elementDescription:
`<zg-body>` is created dynamically by the ZingGrid library, and as such should not be manually added by the
developer.  However the user can style `<zg-body>` using CSS.

ZGButton.elementDescription:
A custom, styled button that can be used both for internal grid-related action and for user-specific
actions. It is stylable via CSS. Some buttons are automatically inserted when a feature that uses it enabled, like `pager`, while
others are inserted manually by the user.

slots.name: icon
slots.description: Button icon. Replaces the default slot.

slots.name: label
slots.description: Button label. Use to add a label when using the "icon" slot.

members.name: action
members.description: Sets the action of the button

members.name: disabled
members.description: Presence of attribute determines if the button is disabled or not

members.name: icon
members.description: Sets the icon for the button

ZGCaption.elementDescription:
A caption can be manually inserted inside the `<zing-grid>` tag as slotted content or automatically
inserted when the `caption` is enabled.  `<zg-caption>` is stylable via CSS.

slots.name: message
slots.description: Caption title. Use when using a feature that enables caption toolbar ([contextMenu], [search], [staticMenu]).

slots.name: tool
slots.description: Caption toolbar, which is added to the rightmost of caption by default.

members.name: align
members.description: The alignment of content in the caption

members.name: position
members.description: Indicates where to position the caption

ZGCard.elementDescription:
The container for a card template that holds a custom template for card mode.  This custom template
will be rendered per row.  `<zg-card>` can be styled via CSS or the `--zg-card-*` selectors.  Please reference
the "Template" section for more details on templates.

members.name: editor
members.description: Sets the custom editor

members.name: editor-template
members.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the card's editor.

members.name: renderer
members.description:
The return value of the method is set as the innerHTML of `<zg-card>`.  If nothing is returned,
it will not change the currently rendered card. The method takes the paramters `data`, `domCard`, and `rowObject`.

members.name: renderer-template
members.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the card's render.

ZGCheckbox.elementDescription:
A checkbox is automatically inserted when
a feature that uses it is enabled, like `<zg-column type="selector">`, or it can be manually-inserted
to the grid. It can be styled via CSS.

members.name: checked
members.description: Presence of attribute determines if the checkbox is checked

ZGColgroup.elementDescription:
`<zg-colgroup>` is a container for the columns of the grid specified by `<zg-column>` tags.  
This element is similar in function to the `<colgroup>` tag in an HTML element.  
Developers should always add this element to their grid structure; however, ZingGrid will insert it 
automatically if it is omitted.  As an non-visual element, you should not apply style to this tag.
Note: Omission of `<zg-colgroup>` may result in a slight performance delay for auto-insertion.

slots.description: Colgroup content that only accepts columns (ZGColumns).

ZGColumn.elementDescription:
The `<zg-column>` tag is used to associate the columns of the grid to the values 
in a dataset.  Attributes on the tag are used to configure both the data type, style, and function 
of the grid column.  It is possible to build grids without explicit `<zg-column>` tags, and in that 
case ZingGrid will add a column for each index in the dataset. However, developers are encouraged to 
explore the features available with `<zg-column>` to utilize the powerful features ZingGrid has to offer.

members.name: align
members.description: Aligns the contents of the cell

members.name: array-index
members.description: If the index is an array of objects, use array-index to indicate which index of the array object to include

members.name: array-slice
members.description: If the index is an array, you can use array-slice to indicate which array indexes to include.

members.name: cell-break
members.description:
The type of `word-break` style for body cells. When not set, `cell-break` style is `normal` by default.
If the width of a column is set, `cell-break` is `word` by default.

members.name: cell-class
members.description:
The class to be set directly on `<zg-cell>` within the column. `cell-class` applied to
`<zg-column>` will overwrite the `cell-class` applied to `<zing-grid>`.

members.name: cell-tooltip-action
members.description: Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

members.name: cell-tooltip-delay
members.description: Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the tooltip

members.name: cell-tooltip-icon
members.description: Specifies the icon to use for the cell tooltip trigger icon when using the info column type

members.name: cell-tooltip-position
members.description: Sets the tooltip-position for the cell

members.name: cell-tooltip-renderer
members.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content

members.name: cell-tooltip-template
members.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display

members.name: cell-tooltip-text
members.description: Sets the tooltip text for the cell of the column.  Can pass this value to renderer or template if using

members.name: cell-tooltip-type
members.description: Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

members.name: content-style
members.description:
When an additional HTML element is added to the renderer, as in the case of image and url,
`content-style` will be put into a style attribute directly on the element.

members.name: content-width
members.description:
Sets the width of the content inside of the cell. Used on cells of column type
`element`, `iframe`, `image`, or `url`.

members.name: default-display
members.description: The data to display in each cell where the data value is null or undefined

members.name: details-renderer
members.description:
Renderer for the details page of a column.
To use a custom renderer, the attribute should be set to the name of the function.
The renderer function takes in the following arguments, `value of index` (for each index), `domCell`, and `cellObject`.
The returned value of the renderer function is set as the innerHTML of the details dialog.

members.name: details-template
members.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the column's details

members.name: drag
members.description: Disables the drag state of a specific column when `column-drag` enabled on `<zing-grid>`

members.name: editor
members.description:
Overrides the default editor for the column.  Can be set to a different built-in editor (based on type of column),
custom editor, or `false` to turn off editor.
If set to a custom editor, the attribute value should be set to the name of the object.
See "Features" page on "Editing: Custom Editor Grid" for more details on custom editor.

members.name: editor-template
members.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the column's editor

members.name: filter
members.description:
Overrides the grid level `filter` attribute.  Presence of attribute enables on `filter` column, otherwise
set to `disabled` to disable.

members.name: filter-index
members.description: Sets the data field index to filter on if index itself has multiple fields.  The value set in index is the default.

members.name: filter-key
members.description: Sets the key for server side filtering.  By default the filterKey is set to the filterIndex value.
members.default: the value of the column's filterIndex

members.name: foot-cell
members.description:
The aggregate function, tokenized string, or function to evaluate for the foot cell of the column.
If using a function, the function takes the parameters `columnData` and `columnFieldIndex`.

members.name: frozen
members.description: Moves the column to the frozen panel specified

members.name: head-cell
members.description:
The aggregate function to evaluate for the head cell of the column.
If using a function, the function takes the parameters `columnData` and `columnFieldIndex`.

members.name: header
members.description: The header name for the column.   If it is not set, the default is to format the `index` value.

members.name: header-auto-format
members.description:
Setting to `disabled` will turn off formatting on the header of the column.  By default, headers will
convert camel, dash, or kebab case to a properly spaced and capitalized string.  Or
set to a function name to customize formatting of header text.  The custom function takes in two parameters,
`index` and `headerText`, and returns the formatted header text.

members.name: header-tooltip-action
members.description: Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

members.name: header-tooltip-delay
members.description: Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the header tooltip

members.name: header-tooltip-icon
members.description: Specifies the icon to use for the header tooltip trigger icon

members.name: header-tooltip-icon-position
members.description: Sets the tooltip icon position for the tooltip icon in the header cells

members.name: header-tooltip-position
members.description: Sets the tooltip-position for the header cell

members.name: header-tooltip-renderer
members.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content

members.name: header-tooltip-template
members.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display

members.name: header-tooltip-text
members.description: Sets the tooltip text for the header cell of the column.  Can pass this value to renderer or template if using

members.name: header-tooltip-trigger
members.description: Sets what part of the header triggers the tooltip.  If set to 'icon', an info icon is added to the header.

members.name: header-tooltip-type
members.description: Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

members.name: hidden
members.description: Presence of attribute hides the column

members.name: index
members.description:
A single index or multiple indices (separated by comma), to associate information in the data source
 to a column in the grid.  Nested data keys are referenced by the member character `.` (Ex. data.key).

members.name: locale
members.description: Localization code used with column type `currency` and `number`

members.name: menu-text
members.description: The text to display in the control menu for the column.  If it is not set, it is set to the header text.

members.name: min-width
members.description: Sets the minimum width of the column in pixels

members.name: renderer
members.description:
Overrides the default renderer for the column.  Can be set to a different built-in or custom renderer.
To use a custom renderer, the attribute should be set to the name of the function.
The renderer function takes in the following arguments, `value of index` (for each index), `domCell`, and `cellObject`.
The returned value of the renderer function is set as the innerHTML of the cell.

members.name: renderer-template
members.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the column's renderer

members.name: required
members.description: Indicates that the column is required to have a value on edit

members.name: resizable
members.description: Turns on column resizing for single column.  Set to `disabled` to turn off resizing on a single column.

members.name: resizable-max-width
members.description: Sets the maximum width the column can be set to when resizing

members.name: resizable-min-width
members.description: Sets the minimum width the column can be set to when resizing

members.name: resizablePersistent
members.description: Modifies the default column resizable persistence.  Set to `disabled` to turn off persistence on a single column.

members.name: search
members.description: Turns off the search on a column if `search` is present on `<zing-grid>`

members.name: separator
members.description: If multiple indices are set, this is the string that separates them in the display.  By default, it is a comma.

members.name: sort
members.description: Turns off the sort on a column if `sort` is present on `<zing-grid>`

members.name: sort-asc
members.description: Presence of attribute sorts the column data in ascending order

members.name: sort-desc
members.description: Presence of attribute sorts the column data in descending order

members.name: sort-intl
members.description: Overrides default behavior for setting special sort for international data

members.name: sorter
members.description:
Overrides the default sorter for the column.  It is also possible to override the column sorting by
passing in method name of sort function instead or setting to `disabled` to disable sorting.  Sorter function
takes in two values (a, b) and returns 1, -1, or 0 indicating if `a > b`, `a < b`, or `a = b`.
Can also be set to a path in the dataset to perform the sort on.  This is useful for sorting object indices.

members.name: type
members.description: The type of the data stored in the column.  The column renderer/editor will behave based on the column type.

values.name: boolean
values.description: Will render a true|false string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="checkbox"`

values.name: button
values.description: Will render a button and the editor is disabled

values.name: checkbox
values.description: Will render a checkbox that can be toggled

values.name: color
values.description: Will render a preview of the color and display a color picker when editing the cell

values.name: currency
values.description: Will render the currency symbol in front of the number and the editor will use an input field with `type="number"`

values.name: custom
values.description:
Will slot in column content and allow referencing data via `[[index.key]]` or `[[record.key]]`, and the editor will
use an input field with `type="text"`

values.name: date
values.description: Will render the date as a string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="date"` expecting (dd/mm/yyyy) dates

values.name: duplicate
values.description: A render only field to display an icon to duplicate the record on click.

values.name: editor
values.description: A render only field to display an icon to edit the record on click

values.name: element
values.description: Will wrap cell content with value specified in `[type-element-tag-name]` with the attribute specified in `[type-element-attribute-name]`

values.name: email
values.description: Will render a string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="email"`

values.name: icon
values.description:
A render only field to set icon to convert the cell data into a built-in grid `<zg-icon name="">` element. 
By default, the value must match the name of a native grid icon or the name of a custom icon. Editing will use an input field with `type="text"`.

values.name: image
values.description: Will render an `` and the editor will use an input field with `type="text"`.

values.name: iframe
values.description: A render only field to display an `<iframe>`. Editing will use an input field with `type="text"`.

values.name: number
values.description: Will render a number as a thousand's separated string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="number"`.

values.name: password
values.description: Will render a hidden string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="password"`.

values.name: percentage
values.description: Will render a number as a percentage string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="number"`.

values.name: radio
values.description: Will render selected option in cell and the editor will use an radio options specified in `typeRadioOptions`.

values.name: range
values.description: Will render a number as a thousand's separated  string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="number"` with optional `min`, `max` and `step` fields defined on the input.

values.name: remover
values.description: A render only field to display an icon to remove the record on click.

values.name: row-number
values.description: A render only field to display the current row index of this row.

values.name: select
values.description: Will render a string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="select"`.

values.name: selector
values.description: A render only field to display an checkbox to selector and remove the record on click.

values.name: tel
values.description: Will render a string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="tel"`.

values.name: text
values.description: (Default Type) Sets the column type to text.

values.name: toggle
values.description: N/A

values.name: url
values.description: Will render the field to to display an `<a>` tag. The editor will use an input field with `type="text"`.

members.name: type-button-disabled
members.description: Presence of attribute sets the button to be in a disabled state. Can also set to "true" or "false".

members.name: type-button-handler
members.description:
When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonHander` to hook up a function call to the button click.
Callback receives rowData, zg-cell DOM, and zg-cell object as arguments.

members.name: type-button-icon
members.description: When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonIcon` to add an icon next to the rendered button in the cell

members.name: type-button-label
members.description: When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonLabel` to add a label to the rendered button in the cell

members.name: type-button-url
members.description: When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonURL` to add a shortcut handler on button click.  The click will automatically open the url in a new window.

members.name: type-checkbox-label
members.description: When the column type is set to `checkbox`, use `typeCheckboxLabel` to add a label next to the rendered checkbox in the cell

members.name: type-color-mode
members.description: Sets the color mode to configure the color picker. Choose between HSL, RGBA, and the default Hex.

members.name: type-color-preview
members.description: Disable the default color swatch UI preview with a false value.

members.name: type-currency
members.description:
The currency to be used in currency formatting.
Currency is set using using the 3 letter currency code specified by ISO 4217 specification (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)

members.name: type-date-format
members.description: The tokenized formatting for a date column

members.name: type-date-from-now
members.description: Indicates if date should be displayed in FromNow format

members.name: type-element-attribute-name
members.description: Sets the attribute of the custom-element in the column when `<zg-column>` has `type` set to `element`

members.name: type-element-tag-name
members.description:
Sets the tag to wrap content when `<zg-column>` has `type` set to `element`.
If `type-element-attribute-name` isn't set, it will put the rendered data into the body of the element.
If `type-element-attribute-name` is set, it will set the attribute to the indexed value.

members.name: type-iframe-ratio
members.description: Sets a `square` ratio instead of the default `16:9`

members.name: type-image-alt
members.description: The alternative text used with the `image` type column

members.name: type-image-mask
members.description: The alternative shape to mask the image

members.name: type-image-src
members.description: If the column type is `image`, use the `type-image-src` attribute to set the src for the image.  The src will be the index value by default.

members.name: type-number-decimals
members.description: Indicates the exact numbers to display after the decimal

members.name: type-number-formatting
members.description: Set to "disabled" to turn off default number formatting

members.name: type-number-max-decimals
members.description: Indicates the maximum numbers to display after the decimal

members.name: type-number-min-decimals
members.description: Indicates the minimum numbers to display after the decimal

members.name: type-radio-options
members.description:
When the column type is set to `radio`, use `typeRadioOptions` to add rendered radio options in the cell.
Can also set as array of name/value pairs where the name is displayed for the given value

members.name: type-range-max
members.description: Maximum value for the input box. Used with the `range` type column in edit mode.

members.name: type-range-min
members.description: Minimum value for the input box.  Used with `range` type column in edit mode.

members.name: type-range-step
members.description: Specifies the step between each legal value for the input box.  Used with `range` type column in edit mode.

members.name: type-select-default-value
members.description: The default value of a new record.  The select box in the create record will default to the specified value.

members.name: type-select-multiple
members.description:
In edit mode, presence of attribute allows column type `select` to have multiple selections, instead of the default
of a single selection

members.name: type-select-options
members.description:
To set the options for the select box for a `select` column when `editor` is enabled on `<zing-grid>`.
Can also set as array of name/value pairs where the name is displayed for the given value

members.name: type-toggle-options
members.description: When the column type is set to `toggle`, use `typeToggleOptions` to set the list of options for the display.

members.name: type-toggle-render-value
members.description: When the column type is set, the render and value will be the same.  This prevents the default creating of true/false for toggles.

members.name: type-url-icon
members.description:
If the column type is `url`, use this attribute to reference any `<zg-icon>` within the library
to replace the link text with this icon.

members.name: type-url-src
members.description: If the column type is `url`, use the `type-url-src` attribute to set the src for the link.  The link will be the index value by default.

members.name: type-url-text
members.description: If the column type is `url`, use the `type-url-text` attribute to set the text displayed for the link.

members.name: validation-error-message
members.description: Sets the validation error message for the column.  Overrides any other settings.

members.name: validation-required-message
members.description: Sets the validation required message for the column.  Overrides any other settings.

members.name: validator
members.description: Sets the validation method for the column.  Overrides the default for the column type

members.name: visibility-priority
members.description:
Used in the case of automatically removing columns on resize.  Columns without a `visibility-priority` never
gets removed. The rest of the columns are removed from highest `visibility-priority` value to the lowest.

members.name: width
members.description: Sets the width of the column.

ZGControlBar.elementDescription:
The `<zg-control-bar>` is inserted dynamically by the ZingGrid library
and serves as a container for the grid's interface controls.  As a generated element, developers
should not manually place `<zg-control-bar>` in their grid; however, they may style the bar and
its internal elements using CSS.

ZGData.elementDescription:
The `<zg-data>` tag is used to associate a dataset with the actual grid.  
A top-level attribute is placed on `<zing-grid>` for basic cases, but when more fine grain 
control is required, `<zg-data>`should be employed and various configuration values set via the 
`options` attribute, or more appropriately via `<zg-param>` tags nested within the tag.

slots.description: Data content that only accepts data configuration options (ZGParams).

members.name: adapter
members.description:
Adapter is a shortcut to set known options for specific third party datasets.  Currently supports `graphql` and  `firebase`.
Developers could register their own custom adapters.  For more information on custom adapters, visit Guides > ZingGrid Object > registerAdapter().

members.name: data
members.description:
Data for the grid presented as an array or object.  If set as an attribute value, the
data needs to be in JSON format.

members.name: id-key
members.description:
In the case of non-key based objects, the idKey can be set to indicate the id to send back to the datasource on CRUD commands.
For example, if the READ URL was https://zinggrid-named.firebaseio.com/ then the UPDATE would be https://zinggrid-named.firebaseio.com/VALUE_OF_IDKEY.

members.name: options
members.description:
Used to set `<zg-param>`, the configuration data for `<zg-data>`.  This should never be used directly as an attribute and
is meant for object instantiation and for setting in JavaScript.

members.name: src
members.description: Specifies the absolute or relative URL to fetch data from to populate the grid

ZGDialog.elementDescription:
The `<zg-dialog>` tag is used internally for dialogs used by 
CRUD (Create, Read, Update, and Delete) actions, as well as to
allow for custom dialogs to be created for generic use with the grid.  The design goal of the
custom element is to extend HTML's `<dialog>` element for a consistent style and more data grid-
related duties.

cssParts.name: form
cssParts.description: Dialog form consisting of header, body, and footer.

cssParts.name: header
cssParts.description: Dialog header consisting of header label and close button.

cssParts.name: body-error
cssParts.description: Dialog error message that appears top of dialog body.

cssParts.name: body-content-wrapper
cssParts.description: Dialog content wrapper that wraps around editor labels and inputs.

cssParts.name: footer
cssParts.description: Dialog footer consisting of footer buttons (cancel and confirm).

members.name: cancel
members.description:
Callback method to call on custom dialog when the dialog's "cancel"
button is clicked

members.name: confirm
members.description:
Callback method to call on custom dialog when the dialog's "confirm"
button is clicked

members.name: label
members.description: Sets the dialog's header 'label' text
displayValues: "Are you sure you want to continue?"

members.name: open
members.description: The presence of the specification-standard `open` attribute designates whether the dialog is shown or hidden

ZGEditorRow.elementDescription:
`<zg-editor-row>` holds the details of the edit mode for the grid.
`<zg-editor-row>` is created internally and should not be placed directly in the user's HTML.

ZGFilter.elementDescription:
`<zg-filter>` is the container for a single cell when the cell contains a filter.
`<zg-filter>` is created internally and should not be placed directly in the user's HTML; however,
the user can style the `<zg-filter>` using the `zg-filter` selector.

members.name: cellindex
members.description: The index of the cell with the filter

ZGFocus.elementDescription:
The `<zg-focus>` element is a generated element added to `<zing-grid>`
when the `selector` attribute is defined.  It is used as a container for the focus of cell(s) 
and used as a CSS target for styling by the developer.  It should not be accessed specifically
beyond styling.

ZGFoot.elementDescription:
The `<zg-foot>` tag contains the foot cells (`<zg-foot-cell>`) of the data 
grid specified via the `foot-cell` attribute found on `<zg-column>` tags.  The tag roughly
corresponds to the idea of the `<tfoot>` tag used in HTML tables.  The `<zg-foot>` tag is 
generated by the library and should not be placed in a grid manually by a developer, but
instead is used as a styling target for CSS.

ZGFooter.elementDescription:
The `<zg-footer>` cell is a simple container element for content placed at the bottom of a grid.  
It may contain `<zg-caption>` or `<zg-source>`, but also may contain arbitrarily defined elements inserted by the 
developer.  The element and its contents are stylable directly using CSS.

ZGFrozenColgroup.elementDescription:
The `<zg-frozen-colgroup>` element is used to define the frozen columns.  
`<zg-frozen-colgroup>` is created internally and should not be placed directly in the user's HTML; however,
the user can style the `<zg-frozen-colgroup>` using the `zg-frozen-colgroup` selector.

ZGHead.elementDescription:
The `<zg-head>` tag contains the head cells (`<zg-head-cell>`) of the data grid specified via the
`head-cell` attribute found on `<zg-column>` tags.  The tag roughly corresponds to the idea of the `<thead>` tag used in
HTML tables.  The `<zg-head>` tag is generated by the library and should not be placed in a grid manually by a developer. Instead, it is used as a styling target for CSS.

ZGHeadCell.elementDescription:
The `<zg-head-cell>` contains header information for a column and is roughly equivalent to the `<th>` 
tag used for HTML tables.  The `<zg-head-cell>` tag is generated by the library and should not be placed in a grid 
manually by a developer. It can be used as a styling target for CSS.

ZGHeader.elementDescription:
`<zg-header>` is the semantic container placed at the top of the grid
to hold various grid items.  `<zg-header>` is created internally and should not be placed
directly in the user's HTML.  The element can be styled via CSS.

ZGIcon.elementDescription:
`<zg-icon>` is used to display custom ZingGrid icons within the grid.  
The icon is set by its name, but can have a different look based on the grid's theme.  
`<zg-icon>` is created internally when a feature that uses it is enabled, like `pager`, 
but can be included in the grid manually as long as the name attribute exists.

members.name: name
members.description: Sets the icon type of `<zg-icon>`

ZGInput.elementDescription:
`<zg-input>` contains input fields with added ZingGrid-specific functionality.
The specific functionality can be set via the `action` attribute.

members.name: action
members.description: The built-in behavior and display of the input.  Gets and sets the associated grid property.

members.name: type
members.description: The type of the input if not using a built-in action

members.name: value
members.description: The value of the input

ZGLayoutControls.elementDescription:
Allows you to switch between normal row mode and condensed card mode for the grid.  
`<zg-layout-controls>` is created internally and should not be placed directly in the user's HTML; however,
the user can style the `<zg-layout-controls>` using the `zg-layout-controls` selector.

ZGLoadMask.elementDescription:
The `<zg-load-mask>` element is used to define the loading overlay that displays
on top of the grid before the grid is completely rendered.  The element is generally dynamically created, 
though it is possible to manually define it for a complex loading screen. Define a simple message and use CSS to style the element.

ZGMenu.elementDescription:
The `<zg-menu>` element is a container for a custom menu for ZingGrid 
used as a context or static (aka "Hamburger") menu.  The element is generally dynamically 
inserted by the library, though the developer can append of overwrite menu with custom 
entries.  The element can be styled using CSS.

slots.description:
Menu content. Overwrites default menu when `[replace]` is present, else appends to the end of the default menu.
Accepts ZGMenuGroup, ZGMenuItem, and ZGSeparator to construct custom menu.

members.name: replace
members.description:
Presence of attribute replaces the default context menu with a custom menu.
If `replace` is not set, the custom menu will be appended to the end of the default menu.

ZGMenuGroup.elementDescription:
A group wrapper for multiple menu items found in the context 
menu.  ZingGrid dynamically creates this element to hold various `<zg-menu-item>` 
tags together for organizational purposes.  As it is a visual element, it can be 
styled via CSS.

slots.name: zgMenuGroupItems
slots.description: Menu group items that only accepts menu items (ZGMenuItems).

ZGMenuItem.elementDescription:
This element defines a single menu item in ZingGrid's context 
menu defined by `<zg-menu>`.  The element is typically dynamically generated, though 
it can be overwritten by a user's own custom `<zg-menu-item>` elements.  The 
element can be styled via CSS.

ZGNoData.elementDescription:
`<zg-no-data>` is used to display a message when there are no records.  The 
element internally wraps any text in a `<div role="any">` tag.  The
element is stylable with CSS like most ZingGrid elements.

ZGPager.elementDescription:
An element that contains the UI controls for paging through a grid's dataset.  The 
element can be manually placed, though it is more often dynamically inserted when paging is enabled via 
the `pager` attribute on the `<zing-grid>` tag.  The element can be styled via CSS.

slots.description: Pager content. If used with the other pager slot, the content is placed beneath the other slots.

slots.name: left
slots.description: Pager content placed in the left.

slots.name: center
slots.description: Pager content placed in the center.

slots.name: right
slots.description: Pager content placed in the right.

members.name: page-size
members.description: Sets the number of records or rows to display per page

members.name: page-size-card
members.description: Sets the number of cards to display per page when in card mode

members.name: page-size-row
members.description: Sets the number of rows to display per page when in row mode

members.name: pagerButtonLimit
members.description: Determines max number of page buttons to display.  Default is 5.

members.name: pagerType
members.description: Determines which type of pagination to use, input or buttons

members.name: position
members.description: Indicates where to position the pager

members.name: size-options
members.description: Sets the options for page size in `zg-option-list`

ZGParam.elementDescription:
`<zg-param>` is a non-visual element used to pass the configuration options for the `<zg-data>` 
element more cleanly via `name`-`value` pairs.  The element is not required, though it is preferred, as everything set 
within a `<zg-param>` element can also be set directly on `<zg-data>` via the `config` attribute.  Developers should note 
that when setting complex values for the `value` attribute to use JSON encoded values.  Also, as a non-visual element, 
CSS styling does not apply to `<zg-param>`.

members.name: name
members.description: Name of parameter

values.name: adapter
values.description:
Adapter is a shortcut to set known options for specific third party datasets.  Currently supports `graphql` and  `firebase`.
Developers could register their own custom adapters.  For more information on custom adapters, visit Guides > ZingGrid Object > registerAdapter().

values.name: idKey
values.description:
In the case of non-key based objects, the idKey can be set to indicate the id to send back to the datasource on CRUD commands.
For example, if the READ URL was https://zinggrid-named.firebaseio.com/ then the UPDATE would be https://zinggrid-named.firebaseio.com/VALUE_OF_IDKEY.

values.name: newIndexPath
values.description:
Specifies the path of the insert or CREATE response that returns an object to indicate the key value of the new record.
By default, it is set to the idKey or the raw value of the response so it would not be necessary to set this property.

values.name: recordPath
values.description:
Sets the path of the JSON object response to where the grid data is located.  When not specified,
it is assumed that the whole JSON object response is the grid data.  This value takes in dot notation.

values.name: nodePath
values.description:
Sets the path of the JSON object within the array.  When not specified,
it is assumed that the array contains the JSON object.  This value takes in dot notation.

values.name: searchKey
values.description: The query parameter to specify the search value

values.name: search
values.description:
The value to search by.  This is automatically generated when search using `<zg-search>`, but the developer
has option to specify if preferred.

values.name: serverFilter
values.description: Boolean value indicating that filtering should take place on the server. Requires `loadByPage` to be enabled.

values.name: sortByKey
values.description: The query parameter to specify the sort field

values.name: sortBy
values.description: Specifies the property to sort on.  This is automatically generated on column sort.

values.name: sortDirKey
values.description: The query parameter that specifies sort direction

values.name: sortDir
values.description: Sets the sort direction.  This is automatically generated on column sort.

values.name: startAtKey
values.description:
The query parameter that specifies the start location.  Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey
or startAtKey when using loadByPage or loadByScroll.

values.name: startAtValue
values.description: Boolean value indicating that a value is required (instead of an index) for the next start value

values.name: limitToKey
values.description: The query parameter to specify limitTo amount.  Required to be used in loadByScroll or loadByPage.

values.name: limitTo
values.description: Sets the page size.  Uses ZingGrid page size by default, so `should not set`.

values.name: pageKey
values.description:
The query parameter to specify the page.  Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey
or startAtKey when using loadByPage or loadByScroll.

values.name: countPath
values.description: Sets the value to path of the total count of records.

values.name: cursor
values.description:
Boolean indicating if we should handle the loadByPage as cursor-based.  
If set to true, no count or number of pages will be displayed.  Used in loadByPage

values.name: loadByPage
values.description:
Boolean value enabling each page of data to be retrieved from server.  Requires setting sortBy in Firebase.  
Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey or startAtKey when using loadByPage.

values.name: loadByScroll
values.description:
Boolean value enabling infinite scrolling. Enabling infinite scrolling requires setting `height` on `<zing-grid>` and 
also setting the following: limitToKey, startAtKey, sortByKey, startAtValue, and sortBy. The first four are set when using Firebase adapter.
Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey or startAtKey when using loadByScroll.

values.name: hasNextPath
values.description: Path to check if there is more data.

values.name: nextPath
values.description:
If set, looks at response packet for full link to next path.  Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey
or startAtKey when using loadByPage.

values.name: nextIDPath
values.description: If set, looks at response packet for ID to next path.

values.name: nextIDKey
values.description:
If set, adds the next key to the URL to get to the next recordset.  Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey
or startAtKey when using loadByPage.

values.name: hasPrevPath
values.description: Path to check if there is previous data.

values.name: prevPath
values.description: If set, looks at repsonse for link to previous path.

values.name: prevIDPath
values.description: If set, looks at response packet for ID to prev path.

values.name: prevIDKey
values.description: If set, adds the prev key to the URL to get to the previous recordset.

values.name: pageBase
values.description: If loadByPage enabled, sets this to base page. The default is 1.

values.name: csvCaption
values.description: Specific to CSV responseType.  Specify if the first line should be the caption

values.name: csvDelimiter
values.description: Specific to CSV responseType.  Specify the separator to split the columns.  ',' is default

values.name: csvHeader
values.description: Specific to CSV responseType.  Specify if the first line (or second if caption defined) should be the column headers

values.name: csvLineSeparator
values.description: Specific to CSV responseType.  Specify the separator to split the rows.  '\r\n' is default

values.name: tableHide
values.description: Hide the table referenced in tableData

values.name: tableHead
values.description: Specifies the values that should be used for the grid's header

values.name: tableDataFormat
values.description: Specifies if the grid should copy the full html value of the data rows or just the text data.

values.name: tableHeadFormat
values.description: Specifies if the grid should copy the full html value of the header row or just the text data.

values.name: collection
values.description: Specific to the firebaseSDK.  Sets the firebase collection to use.

values.name: subscription
values.description: Specific to the firebaseSDK.  Set to true if you want to use subscription mode.

values.name: createOptions
values.description:
Sets the options for CREATE request. Options are formatted as a JSON string.
Avalable options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not neccessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

values.name: readOptions
values.description:
Sets the options for READ request. Options are formatted as a JSON string.
Available options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not necessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

values.name: updateRowOptions
values.description:
Sets the options for UPDATE row request. 
Available options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not necessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

values.name: updateCellOptions
values.description:
Sets the options for UPDATE cell request. 
Available options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not necessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

values.name: updateOptions
values.description:
Sets the options for UPDATE request. Options can be set to either "cell" or "row" updates, the types of updates used in ZingGrid; 
options are formatted as a JSON string.
Available options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not necessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

values.name: deleteOptions
values.description:
Sets the options for DELETE request. Options are formatted as a JSON string.
Available options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not necessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

values.name: src
values.description: Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the request. ID is automatically inserted in the `src` for DELETE and UPDATE requests.

values.name: createSrc
values.description: Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the create request.

values.name: readSrc
values.description: Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the read request.

values.name: updateRowSrc
values.description: Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the update row request.

values.name: updateCellSrc
values.description: Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the update cell request.

values.name: deleteSrc
values.description: Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the delete request.

values.name: restmode
values.description:
Set to "manual" if you want to turn off traditional REST URL construction and method setting.
The method settings for `restmode="manual"` is GET = GET and the all other = POST. To update
method settings, use `updateCellMethod`, `deleteMethod`, etc.

values.name: method
values.description: Option for request type (GET, POST, PUT, etc).  ZingGrid uses the standard request type per action, but it can overwritten with this param.

values.name: createMethod
values.description: Sets the method on the create request

values.name: readMethod
values.description: Sets the method on the read request

values.name: updateRowMethod
values.description: Sets the method on the update row request

values.name: updateCellMethod
values.description: Sets the method on the update cell request

values.name: deleteMethod
values.description: Sets the method on the the delete request

values.name: headers
values.description: Option for request type. Sets headers for request.

values.name: queryString
values.description: Option for request type. Adds an additional query string to request.

values.name: body
values.description:
Sets the body or query string of the request, which overwrites the ZingGrid generated query string. 
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: bodyMethodSuffix
values.description:
Sets the suffix for the function name that will construct the body for the request.  
Will set the `createBody`, `readBody`, `updateRowBody`, `updateCellBody`, and `deleteBody` parameters to:
   `create` + suffix
   `read` + suffix
   `updateRow` + suffix
   `updateCell` + suffix
   `delete` + suffix

values.name: createBody
values.description:
Sets the body on the create request
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: readBody
values.description:
Sets the body on the read request
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: updateRowBody
values.description:
Sets the body on the update row request
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: updateCellBody
values.description:
Sets the body on the update cell request
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: deleteBody
values.description:
Sets the body on the delete request
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: createCustomFunction
values.description:
Sets the function that handles the external data handling for creating new records
The function takes in `recordId`, `rawData`, and `options` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: readCustomFunction
values.description:
Sets the function that handles the external data handling for reading data
The function takes in `options` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: updateCellCustomFunction
values.description:
Sets the function that handles the external data handling for updating a cell of data
The function takes in `recordId`, `rawData`, and `options` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: updateRowCustomFunction
values.description:
Sets the function that handles the external data handling for updating a row of data
The function takes in `recordId`, `rawData`, and `options` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: deleteCustomFunction
values.description:
Sets the function that handles the external data handling for delete
The function takes in `recordId`, `rawData`, and `options` and returns an object to send as body for request.

values.name: serverErrorMessage
values.description: Sets the error message for any server errors.  Use [[serverMessage]] token to set message from server

values.name: serverErrorPath
values.description: serverErrorPath: Sets the path to the server error message if response is JSON.

values.name: exclude
values.description: If enabled, method will not call the external REST API

values.name: cdataEscape
values.description: If enabled, method will escape HTML wrapped in CDATA blocks on xml decoding

values.name: requestType
values.description: Sets the Content Type for the request. The default is application/json.

values.name: responseType
values.description: Sets the expected Content Type for the response. The default is application/json.

values.name: dataType
values.description: Sets the expected data type for a static data source. The default is application/json.

values.name: urlSuffix
values.description: Any string to place at the end of a REST constructed URL. Note that this cannot be used with `restmode` is set to 'manual'.

values.name: mode
values.description: Sets to 'cors' to specify the settings for cors request.  The external server must enable 'cors' for this to take effect.

members.name: value
members.description: The value for given data key.  If the value is an object, format as JSON encoded version of string.

ZGRow.elementDescription:
`<zg-row>` is the container for the `<zg-cell>`, `<zg-head-cell>`, and `<zg-filter>` elements.
It corresponds to the `<tr>` tag on an HTML table.
The `<zg-row>` element is created dynamically and should not be placed in the grid by a developer.  
However, the element is useful for styling the various rows of the grid using CSS.

ZGSearch.elementDescription:
The `<zg-search>` element is used to encapsulate the interface widget necessary for searching the grid -- 
typically a text field and a button to trigger the search.  The element is added dynamically when search is specified and 
should not be directly inserted by the developer.  The element and its contents can be styled using CSS.

ZGSelect.elementDescription:
A custom select dropdown defined by our library. The
dropdown can be assigned different options through the `options` attribute.

members.name: action
members.description: The actions of the select dropdown. The current option is pagesize.

members.name: options
members.description: The comma separated string list of options to go into the Select Element

members.name: value
members.description: The default value of the select dropdown

ZGSelectorMask.elementDescription:
`<zg-selector-mask>` is used to wrap the cells during user selection for 
styling purposes.  The element is dynamically added to the grid based upon the presence of the 
`selector` attribute on the `<zing-grid>` element.  The element should not be manually inserted, 
though it can be styled using CSS.

ZGSeparator.elementDescription:
`<zg-separator>` specifies the horizontal bar in the `<zg-menu>` used for separating 
items.  The element is created dynamically and should not be manually inserted by developers.  However,
`<zg-separator>` can be styled using CSS.

ZGSource.elementDescription:
`<zg-source>` is used to source the data in ZingGrid.  The 
element internally wraps any text in a `<cite role="any">` tag for proper semantics.  The
element is stylable with CSS like most ZingGrid elements.

members.name: position
members.description: Indicates where to position the source

ZGStatus.elementDescription:
`<zg-status>` is a custom element used to display messages to the 
user, such as errors and verifications of CRUD actions.  `<zg-status>` is created 
dynamically and should not be inserted manually.  The `<zg-status>` element is 
stylable with CSS.

ZGText.elementDescription:
`<zg-text>` is a ZingGrid specific text value that is bound to 
the status of the grid, as defined by the `value` attribute.  The field can be 
manually inserted by a developer, but is more commonly added by the use of certain 
grid features, like paging.  The element is stylable with CSS.

members.name: value
members.description:
Specifies what value to generate in text field.  Current built-in options are
pager-related information.

values.name: currpage
values.description: Display the current page of the grid.

values.name: pagecount
values.description: Displays the total amount of pages in the grid

values.name: pagesize
values.description: Displays the current `page-size` of the grid

values.name: startrow
values.description: Displays the current starting row index, of the current page, in the grid

values.name: endrow
values.description: Displays the current end row index, of the current page, in the grid

values.name: rowcount
values.description: Displays the total amount of rows in the grid

ZGTooltip.elementDescription:
`<zg-tooltip>` elements are inserted dynamically by the ZingGrid library
and serves as a container for the grid's tooltips.  As a generated element, developers
should not manually place `<zg-tooltip>` in their grid; however, they may style the tooltips and
its internal elements using CSS.

ZingGrid.elementDescription:
The most important tag in the library. Contains most of the attributes to turn grid features on/off. 
Set `zing-grid:not(:defined) {display:none;}` to hide <zing-grid> instances until they are ready. 
This stops child elements from appearing unstyled for a brief moment.

slots.description: Grid content or configuration that accepts `<zg-*>` elements that are allowed to be manually inserted.

members.name: align
members.description: Aligns the contents of all column cells (center|left|right)

members.name: button-tooltip-disabled
members.description: Turns off the tooltips on all buttons in the grid

members.name: caption
members.description: The caption for the grid

members.name: card
members.description: Specifies the defined `<zg-card>` of the grid.  More appropriate to use `<zg-card>` in most cases or set the property programmatically.

members.name: cell-break
members.description:
The type of `word-break` style for body cells. When not set, `cell-break` style is `normal` by default.
If the width of a column is set, `cell-break` is `word` by default.
To overwrite `cell-break` for cells in a specific column, set `cell-break` for that column.

members.name: cell-class
members.description:
Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in the grid. This attribute can be applied to both
`<zing-grid>` or `<zg-column>`. If the attribute is applied to both, `<zg-column>`'s `cell-class` overwrites `<zing-grid>`'s `cell-class`.
To set a class conditionally, set `cell-class` to the name of the function, which takes in the arguments: `cellData`, `domContainer`, `cellObject`.

members.name: cell-editor
members.description: Turns cell editing on or off. Automatically turned on when setting `editor` or `editor-controls`.

members.name: cell-focus
members.description: Turns off keyboard nav cell focus if set to disabled

members.name: cell-tooltip-action
members.description: Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

members.name: cell-tooltip-delay
members.description:
Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the tooltip. If delay is not specified,
it is 1000ms on cell tooltips without an icon and 0ms on cell tooltips with an icon.

members.name: cell-tooltip-icon
members.description: Specifies the icon to use for the info column types

members.name: cell-tooltip-position
members.description: Sets the tooltip-position for the cell

members.name: cell-tooltip-renderer
members.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content

members.name: cell-tooltip-template
members.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display

members.name: cell-tooltip-type
members.description: Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

members.name: col-class
members.description:
Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in targeted `<zg-column>`. To
apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run
on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `fieldIndex`, `domContainer`,
and `colObject`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

members.name: column-drag
members.description: Enables column dragging

members.name: column-drag-action
members.description:
Specifies the action of dragging allowed.  By default, if `column-drag` is
enabled then `column-drag-action` is set `"both"`.  This property will turn on column-drag if not already set.

members.name: column-resizable
members.description:
Presence of attribute turns on column resizing for all columns.
This excludes internal column types (), which requires setting ZGColumn[resizable] on the column.

members.name: column-resizable-max-width
members.description: Sets the maximum width columns can be set to when resizing

members.name: column-resizable-min-width
members.description: Sets the minimum width columns can be set to when resizing

members.name: column-resizable-persistent
members.description: Presence of attribute displays column resizing for all columns without hover

members.name: column-width
members.description: Sets the width each of the columns

members.name: columns
members.description: Specifies the columns of the grid.  More appropriate to use `<zg-column>` in most cases or set the property programmatically.

members.name: columns-control
members.description: Presence of attribute turns on the menu to show and hide columns

members.name: compact
members.description: Augments internal themes to a compact mode

members.name: config
members.description:
Used to set multiple grid properties at once.  This should never be used directly.
This is meant for object instantiation.

members.name: confirm-delete
members.description: Turns off delete confirmation if set to disable

members.name: context-menu
members.description:
Enables the default `<zing-grid>` context menu or set to the id name of a custom `<zg-menu>`.  If
set to a custom menu and `<zg-menu>` has the `replace` attribute present, then the custom menu will replace the context menu.
Otherwise the contents of the custom menu is appended to the end of context menu.

members.name: creator
members.description: Sets the create editor to modal (default) or inline.

members.name: data
members.description: Data for the grid presented as an array or object

members.name: default-display
members.description: The data to display in each cell where the data value is null or undefined

members.name: dialog
members.description: Sets `<zg-dialog>` to display dialog and mask within the grid dimensions instead of the whole screen

members.name: dir
members.description: The HTML standard direction to indicate direction of grid's columns and text

members.name: editor
members.description:
Turns on the grid editor.  Enables single cell editing via double click.
Sets the editor to inline (default) or modal.

members.name: editor-controls
members.description: Adds columns for the editor controls.  If it is added, default is "all".

members.name: filter
members.description: Enables filtering for all columns.  Can be turned on/off individually via column.

members.name: foot-class
members.description:
Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in the `<zg-foot>`. To
apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run 
on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `fieldIndex`, `domContainer`,
and `colObject`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

members.name: frozen-columns-left
members.description: Sets the number of columns to freeze to the left

members.name: frozen-columns-right
members.description: Sets the number of columns to freeze to the right

members.name: frozen-row-class
members.description:
Adds a class to each `<zg-row>` element. To
apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run
on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `data`, `rowIndex` (1-based),
 `domRow`, and `rowObject`, `rowParent`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

members.name: frozen-rows-bottom
members.description: Sets the number of rows to freeze to the bottom

members.name: frozen-rows-top
members.description: Sets the number of rows to freeze to the top

members.name: gridlines
members.description: Sets vertical, horizontal or both grid lines to the grid

members.name: head-class
members.description:
Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in the `<zg-head>`. To
apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run 
on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `fieldIndex`, `domContainer`,
and `colObject`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

members.name: header-auto-format
members.description:
Converts camel, dash, and kebab case to properly spaced and capitalized typography.
Setting to `disabled` will turn off formatting on headers.  Set to a function name to customize formatting of headers.

members.name: header-tooltip-action
members.description: Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

members.name: header-tooltip-delay
members.description: Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the header tooltip

members.name: header-tooltip-icon
members.description: Specifies the icon to use for the header tooltip trigger icon

members.name: header-tooltip-icon-position
members.description: Sets the tooltip icon position for the tooltip icon in the header cells

members.name: header-tooltip-position
members.description: Sets the tooltip-position for the header cell

members.name: header-tooltip-renderer
members.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content

members.name: header-tooltip-template
members.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display

members.name: header-tooltip-trigger
members.description: Sets what part of the header triggers the tooltip.  If set to 'icon', an info icon is added to the header.

members.name: header-tooltip-type
members.description: Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

members.name: height
members.description:
Sets the height of the grid.  If the height is less than the size of the content, scrolling is added
to grid body.

members.name: icon-set
members.description:
Allows the user to change the grid icon set to an allowed 3rd-party type (e.g., Font-Awesome).
To use a custom icon set, the icon set must first be registered.

members.name: icon-set-data
members.description: If setting [icon-set="custom"], points to the custom JSON key/value mapping

members.name: lang
members.description: Sets the language to use for the grid

members.name: layout
members.description:
Sets the grid layout to be either `card` or `row` and adds `<zg-layout-controls>` to the grid.
The default is based on the size of the user's screen, unless `layout` is set.

members.name: layout-controls
members.description:
When `layout` is set, by default `layout-controls` is enabled.
To hide, set `layout-controls` to `disabled`.  Presence of this attribute will enable
`<zg-layout-controls>` even if `layout` is not set.

members.name: loading
members.description:
Presence of attribute adds loading state to grid, which triggers `<zg-load-mask>` to show.
This attribute allows styling the height of the grid (via CSS) before the data has loaded in the grid.

members.name: loading-text
members.description: Sets the text to display in the `<zg-load-mask>` on data load

members.name: loadmask
members.description: Set `loadmask="disabled"` to prevent the `<zg-load-mask>` from showing on data load.

members.name: nested-data-separator
members.description:
Indicates separator that should be used for nested headers and data paths.  By default, the '.' is used: 'fullName.first'
Setting to `disabled` will turn off parsing for nested headers and will not look at pathing for data

members.name: no-data
members.description: Sets the message that appears in the `<zg-no-data>` element when there are no records

members.name: page-size
members.description: Sets the number of records or rows to display per page. Can be set only if `pager` is set.

members.name: page-size-card
members.description: Sets the number of cards to display per page when in card mode. Can be set only if `pager` is set.

members.name: page-size-options
members.description: Sets the options for page size in `zg-option-list`. Can be set only if `pager` is set.

members.name: page-size-row
members.description: Sets the number of rows to display per page when in row mode. Can be set only if `pager` is set.

members.name: pager
members.description: Adds pagination functionality and controls to the grid

members.name: pager-button-limit
members.description: Determines max number of page buttons to display.  Default is 5.

members.name: pager-position
members.description:
Sets pager position. Note: `pager` attribute or `<zg-pager>` must be present in
order to position pager.

members.name: pager-type
members.description: Determines which type of pagination to use, input or buttons

members.name: params
members.description: Name/Value pairs of `<zg-param>` values.  More appropriate to use `<zg-param>` in most cases.

members.name: preserve-state-id
members.description:
The ID to use as the key in storing the state.  Each grid should have a unique ID or else the state data 
will be shared across grids.

members.name: preserve-state-load
members.description: The method to call when state is ready to be retrieved.  Must also set preserveStateSave and preserveStateId

members.name: preserve-state-options
members.description:
Comma separated list of features to save in state preservation.  
Options are 'columnfrozen', 'columnposition', 'columnvisibility', 'columnwidth', 'filter', 'layout', 'page', 'pagesize', 'rowfrozen', 'rowselector', 'search', 'selector', 'sort'
NOTE:  If columnfrozen is set, then columnposition will implicitly be set as well

members.name: preserve-state-save
members.description: The method to call when state is ready to be saved.  Must also set preserveStateLoad and preserveStateId.

members.name: record-count
members.description:
Sets the total record count.  Useful for `loadByPage` when the response packet
does not return total count of records.

members.name: record-duplicate
members.description: Adds the duplicate control to the end of the row before the edit controls

members.name: record-key
members.description: Adds the record key column to the grid.  If set to a string, the string is the header text.

members.name: row-class
members.description:
Adds a class to each `<zg-row>` element. To
apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run
on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `data`, `rowIndex` (1-based),
 `domRow`, and `rowObject`, `rowParent`, `bodyRowIndex` (1 based), and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

members.name: row-height
members.description:
Sets the height of each body row.  By default, the body row height is set to 'auto' where it will auto fit the content.
In the case of frozen columns, the default body row height is '48px' because there is a performance hit when using 'auto' with
frozen columns.

members.name: row-selector
members.description: Adds `selector` type column to the rows as the first column

members.name: search
members.description:
Turns on the search feature and adds `<zg-search>` to the grid.
The search button appears in the caption header.

members.name: selector
members.description:
Turns on the selector feature on the grid and adds
`<zg-selector-mask>` to the grid

members.name: server-rendered
members.description: Indicates that the grid was completely rendered on the server and embedded in the page

members.name: sort
members.description:
Enables sorting on all columns.  It is possible to disable specific columns
via the column's object or setting `sort="disabled"` to specified columns.

members.name: sort-intl
members.description: Overrides default behavior for international sorting.  Turn off international sorting with `sort-intl="disabled"`.

members.name: sorter
members.description:
Override the column sorting by passing in method name of sort function instead.  Sorter function
takes in two values (a, b) and returns 1, -1, or 0 indicating if `a > b`, `a < b`, or `a = b`.

members.name: source
members.description: Defines the source of the data in the grid. Adds the `<zg-source>` element.

members.name: src
members.description: Specifies the absolute or relative URL to fetch data from to populate the grid

members.name: static-menu
members.description:
Adds a display button that launches the contextmenu.  If
set to a custom menu and `<zg-menu>` has the `replace` attribute present, then the custom menu will replace the context menu.
Otherwise the contents of the custom menu is appended to the end of context menu.

members.name: status-delay
members.description: Changes the duration a status message will remain visible until it automatically closes (in milliseconds)

members.name: status-persist
members.description: Prevents status messages from automatically closing after a delay

members.name: status-position
members.description: Positions the status message in one of nine positions relative to the grid

members.name: template-end-delimiter
members.description: Defines the regex expression for closing data binding

members.name: template-start-delimiter
members.description: Defines the regex expression for starting data binding

members.name: theme
members.description:
Sets the theme of the grid.  Built-in themes are specified by keyword, but custom theme
names are also accepted by setting a URL path to your custom css theme file.  For custom themes, on load set `theme`
to the path to the custom theme file.  After, set to theme name to switch themes.

members.name: validation-error-message
members.description: Sets the default validation error message

members.name: validation-required-message
members.description: Sets the default validation required message

members.name: viewport
members.description: Internal attribute.  Should not be set.

members.name: viewport-pause
members.description: Keeps current value of `viewport` and freezes the breakpoint

members.name: viewport-stop
members.description: Removes `viewport` attribute, disabling viewport resizing

members.name: viewport-types
members.description:
Sets custom `viewport` breakpoints (value string-object must be valid JSON).
NOTE: If you don't set `mobile`, the grid won't auto-set card or row mode.

members.name: width
members.description: Sets the width of the grid.  If the width is less than the size of the content, scroll is added to `<zg-body>`.

members.name: zebra
members.description:
Presence of attribute adds the classes, `zebra-1` and `zebra-2`, alternating on `<zg-row>` elements.  Setting to a
list of class names will assign classes in sequential order.  For conditional zebra classes, `zebra` also accepts name of function that
returns a class name to use for zebra striping.
